properties.name: Bicentennial Tower
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184Erie PA 16507Just a tower. On the bayfront. One time, when I took the elevator to the top, I think there were seagulls nesting in the shaft or something because they started, like, screaming bloody murder. I laughed so hard my stomach hurt the next day.

properties.name: Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  1280 S Decatur Blvd Las Vegas NV 89102Dood! Ok, they always tell you that you can eat cheap but well in Vegas. Generally, this is not the case. Except here. Granted, I haven\'t had anything /but/ breakfast at Blueberry Hill, but I

properties.name: Carnegie Science Center
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  One Allegheny Ave, Pittsburgh PA 15212The science center of my youth! Many the day did I beg mom to take me here. And sometimes she did. In fact, I just visited this past January, and discovered that they have a kitchen "lab," where you can learn about the science of food. Very Alton Brown-ish. I almost want to move back to PA just so I can use that kitchen. . .

properties.name: Death Valley National Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Death Valley National Park, CAAh Death Valley. You can go from up in the mountains to way below sea level, all at the same park. When I went in the spring, there were tons of pretty flowers, though I am told this was soley due to unusual amounts of rain. I recommend Death Valley, except in the summer. DO NOT go here in the summer. Your car will overheat, I kid you not.

properties.name: Desert Botanical Garden
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184   1201 North Galvin Parkway, Phoenix, AZ 85008You know, I got to visit the Botanical Garden in Phoenix a few years ago, and it stuck with me. Really, it\'s one of my top 10 most favorite places. It\'s also an excellent example of how much variety the desert has to offer. If you go, take a camera and much water :)

properties.name: East Erie Assembly of God
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1842653 Saltsman Rd Erie Pa 16510The church I attended when I lived in Erie. I\'m still in contact with some of the people there, actually :)

properties.name: Erie Public Library
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184 160 East Front St Erie PA 16507My top favorite library. The top floor has huge windows that overlook the bayfront. Also, there\'s an authentic reproduction of an 1800\'s battleship parked in the water behind the building. And you can tour it in the summer.

properties.name: Erie Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184423 W. 38th St, Erie, PA 16508I remember that for one of my psychology classes, we had an assignment on behavioral observation. So the prof took us to the Erie Zoo and we watched lemurs. Such fond memories. The Erie Zoo is nice and small, and has some nifty exhibits. Around the time I left town, they were planning some major explansions, so I don\'t know what the zoo is like now. But, it\'s free in the winter, so if you happen to be in Erie (and can make it through the snow) perhaps you should stop by.

properties.name: Fernbank Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  767 Clifton Rd NE Atlanta GA 30307Ohmygosh this place was fun. I went with a group of college students, all of us researchers in the same psychology lab. We had a blast. There was this one exhibit where you could make bubbles as big as your torso. . .we literally chased off little kids so we could keep playing.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Grand Canyon National ParkWell, what can I say. It\'s the Grand Canyon. It\'s amazing. I\'ve only ever visited the southern rim, which is a 5 hour drive from Vegas. You can find a lot of touristy stuff there, like gift shops and the information center. Also, if you want to catch a mule ride into the canyon, you start at the south rim (however, make sure to book well in advance).

properties.name: Inniswood Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184   940 S. Hempstead Rd, Westerville OH 43081Man. I love this place. I have friends who live in Columbus, and would honestly consider moving there just because I\'d be near Inniswood. There\'s a lovely rose garden, a Japanese water feature, a nice foresty boardwalk area, and these cute stone walled gardens.

properties.name: Japanese Car Service
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1843910 Spring Mountain Rd, Las Vegas NV 89102Growing up, my dad would fix all car problems I ever had. Well, short of dad, this place is the best. They\'re so very honest, the cost is reasonable, and they\'ve been able to revive my franken-car time and again.

properties.name: Kennywood Amusement Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184 4800 Kennywood Boulevard West Mifflin, PA 15122 This amusement park has the best wooden rollercoaster I\'ve ever ridden: The Thunderbolt. It still thrills me :) This was the place to go for school picnics.

properties.name: Lied Library
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184 4505 Maryland Pkwy Las Vegas NV 89154Being a student, I spend a lot of time in libraries, and, well, I consider myself an expert at finding good "spots" to hunker down and study. Lied library\'s best spot is the fifth floor. You get a swell view of Vegas through these huge windows, there are comfy chairs, and places to plug in your laptop, should you have it with you. There\'s also a coffee shop on the first floor, but the food ain\'t so great. . .you might want to bring your own.

properties.name: Linn Run State Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Linn Run Road, Rector PA 15677I think I visited Linn Run every summer I came home from college. There\'s this one little set of mini-rapids with smooth rocks that my friends and I would use as a natural water slide and swimming pool.

properties.name: Metro Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1844001 South Decatur Blvd Las Vegas NV 89103You know, there isn\'t a lot of good pizza in this city. Except here. They have both New York and Chicago styles, and both are yummy.

properties.name: Neon Boneyard
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184821 Las Vegas Blvd N, Las Vegas NV 89101Ever wonder what happens to neon signs when nobody loves them anymore? Some of them end up here. The Boneyard is a bunch of retired signs strewn around an otherwise empty lot. Even though that doesn\'t sound so exciting, actually, you should go see it.

properties.name: Ohiopyle State Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Ohiopyle PA 15470Dad used to take us here in the summer to go biking. My brother and I weren\'t the most physically fit kids in the world, yet we still managed to ride for miles. We also went canoeing once (wish we\'d do it again), and I seem to recall a rockin\' awesome natural waterslide.

properties.name: Oregon Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1844001 Southwest Canyon Road, Portland, OR, 97221Every time I go to a new city, I try to visit the local zoo. \'Cause I\'m cool like that. And by cool, I mean nerdy. Anyway, this was a nice small zoo. Nothing spectacular, but it had a cool wolf exhibit. And it was easy to get to (Portland has a kick butt mass transit system).

properties.name: Oscar's Pub
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184 2147 W 12th St, Erie, PA 16505Three words: Big Ass Fish. That is honestly what it\'s called. Oscar\'s serves a HUGE fish sandwich every, um, Friday I think. My family eats here when we visit Erie.

properties.name: Penn State Erie
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1845091 Station Rd, Erie PA 16563My Alma Mater. I loved this college--I had small classes and great profs. Plus some of the buildings were converted farmhouses, and they were beautiful.

properties.name: Presque Isle State Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Peninsula Dr, Erie PAAh, man, the nostalgia! My family went on vacation here every year for, well, years. I also went to college in Erie, and worked in the town for a while. Anyway, Presque Isle. . .it has beaches, marshes, bike trails, festivals, and the tendency to lose 10% of its land mass every year to erosion.

properties.name: Red Rock Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Red Rock Canyon National Conservation AreaI\'m more about parks and nature than casinos, so Red Rock is my cup of tea. It\'s close to Vegas, and out of town visitors get a good idea of desert landscape from it. Plus, if you hike the Children\'s Discovery Trail. . .theres totally this lone pine tree that smells like butterscotch. For real.

properties.name: Santa Monica Pier
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica CABeen here once for, like, half an hour. I totally want to go back. It\'s just like you see in the movies. Plus, the nearby Third Street Promenade has great shopping.

properties.name: Schramm Farm
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1841002 Blank Rd, Jeannettte PA 15644I have sooo many good memories of this farm. Hayrides, hot apple cider, corn mazes, and then searching for the perfect pumpkin in a huge field in October. And mom would always let my brother and I get maple sugar candy at the small general store.

properties.name: The Artful Potter
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184   8825 South Eastern Suite 114 Las Vegas NV 89123If you\'re a crafty type, you can pick out and paint your own pottery here. They have lots of quirky little things to work on, and the staff is super nice and helpful.

properties.name: The Atomic Testing Museum
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  755 East Flamingo Road Las Vegas NV 89119Nevada has a semi-long and, erm, glorious history as an atomic test site. Find out more about it at this museum. And, for the particularly nerdy types, once a month you can tour the (still active) weapons test site 65 miles north of the city. Woot!

properties.name: The Cupcakery
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1849680 S. Eastern Ave. Suite 100 Henderson, NVBest cupcakes you will ever eat. Period. Lots of unusual flavor combinations, too.

properties.name: The District
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  2240 Village Walk Drive, Henderson Nevada 89052Ok. Just to shoot straight with you: Vegas really doesn\'t have a lot of cultural activities. Yet. But The District is making an attempt, and I give them mad kudos for it. Every so often, this shopping area hosts free festivals and concerts. You can check their website for a schedul of events. And, the shopping is pretty good too.

properties.name: The Fix
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1842031 W Sunset Rd, Henderson, NV 89014This is, like, church Vegas style. The Fix is associated with the Assemblies of God, and offers alternative rock worship music on Sunday mornings. Service is held at the E-String bar and grill at 11:00am. But you should come early, because it fills up fast.

properties.name: The Grand Lux Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  3355 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV 89109The Grand Lux is inside the Venetian Hotel And Casino. It\'s pretty standard Cheescake Factory type food, with the exception of The Grand Appetizer Platter. It. Is. Awesome. Anytime I have visitors, I try to make sure they try it. It\'s huge, you get really, really good (and slightly unusual) food, and it costs only about 5 for four people.

properties.name: Tokyo
properties.description: Posted by AnnetasticTokyo, JapanWent here during my 16th summer

properties.name: Twin Lakes Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  252 Twin Lakes Rd, Latrobe, PA 15650Twin Lakes is the place to be in Western PA ;) Well, for me at least. In the summer they host an Arts festival, during which I pig out big time on the best festival food ev-ah. And then you can also rent these little paddle boats and cruise around the lower lake (never done this, but will one day). And I think nearly every year my friends and I would have some sort of party at a park pavilion.

properties.name: Underground Atlanta
properties.description: Posted by Lxk18455 Martin Luther King Dr, Atlanta, GA 30303It\'s a shopping center. Under the ground. That is all.

properties.name: Valley of Fire State Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Valley of Fire, NVThe Valley of Fire is so easy to get to from Vegas. Just take the I-15 North for about an hour. There are lots of interesting rock formations, and I highly recommend you hike Mouse\'s Tank.

properties.name: Wintergreen Gorge Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1842601 Norcross Rd Erie PA 16510As soon as the weather got semi-warm in Erie, I\'d go to Wintergreen Gorge Cemetery to jog. It\'s so not weird! The place looks like a park, and it\'s not unusual to see people picnicing or riding bikes there. Out of all the things I miss about the East, I think I miss walking in this cemetery the most.

properties.name: Zion National Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Zion National Park UTThis park is beautiful. It\'s got forests (something I miss, living in Vegas) and these crazy roads that go straight through the mountain. Plus, it\'s only 2.5 hours from Vegas if you take the I-15. Sweet!

properties.name: Zoo Atlanta
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184800 Cherokee Ave Atlanta GA 30315Well, I can\'t say too much about this zoo. I knew somebody who knew somebody, and was supposed to get an after hours tour. Sadly, it fell though because most of the animals were sleeping. And then the janitors kicked my group out. But I think it is probably a very nice place. The panda exhibit rocked.
